text.div: Patient with chronic nasal obstruction and hyposmia on the left side

The patient presented with chronic nasal obstruction and hyposmia on the left side, which had been present for six months. The symptoms were not relieved by self-administered medications. On clinical examination, a bump was noted along the floor of the left nasal cavity.

code.text: Plain radiograph of the paranasal sinus and nasal cavity

resource.valueString: A plain radiograph of the paranasal sinus and nasal cavity revealed a radiopaque focus in the left nasal cavity.

A CT scan of paranasal sinuses was performed, revealing a tooth-like bony structure in the hard palate extending into the left inferior nasal cavity, resembling a canine with a relatively smaller size, along with a deviated nasal septum with convexity to the left.

An Orthopantomogram showed a tooth-like radiopaque structure, and a three-dimensional computed tomography (3D CT) scan showed a tooth-like structure in the left nasal cavity. The intranasal tooth was supernumerary, with mild mucosal thickening noted in the bilateral maxillary and sphenoid sinuses.

coding.display: Nasal/sinus endoscopy, surgical with maxillary antrostomy

code.text: Endoscopic removal of the ectopic intranasal tooth

outcome.text: Complete resolution of nasal obstruction and hyposmia

resource.description: Follow-up to monitor symptoms and ensure complete recovery
